A cheetah that has a genetic disorder that prevents it from running could be genetically modified to have a different set of genes that would allow it to run.
A cheetah that has a physical injury that prevents it from running could be trained to use a wheelchair or other assistive device to help it move around.
A cheetah that has a psychological issue that prevents it from wanting to run could be trained with positive reinforcement techniques to encourage it to run.
A cheetah that has a medical condition that prevents it from running could be treated with medication or other medical interventions to alleviate the condition.
A cheetah that has a cultural or societal issue that prevents it from running could be educated about the benefits of running and encouraged to participate in running activities.
